results.content:
Hi,
I've been working in IT for almost 30 years now. I started out as a Cobol guy on a IBM machine, worked with Big Data before the term was known by the people who live in San Francisco :) , did business intelligence, I built data warehouses, did client-server programming with VB en C# and other languages, took care of user support and networking/security and stuff like that.  Since last year I'm being confronted with a technology shift, and I found it hard to compete with 20 year old developers, since these guys have a totally different grasp of modern environments and techniques. I'm talking about MVC, Bower, Grunt, Bundle, Knockout and other JS packages that are so popular right now. This course is a very good appetizer and I understand now that JS is the new stepmother of all client side web programming. I will learn it. Gone are the days of Form applications and stuff you have to install on your PC. The future is all about web clients. Irfan Dayan is a really good teacher, who understands the art of explaining things. This course is clear, well defined and very to the point, even for more experienced people then me. Irfan really helps me to look forward again. Thanks a lot!

results.content:
Great course, I have always done back end code before php , python , mysql ect and never even looked into front end. I have gained alot of knowledge from this course already. It starts a little slow if you are a experienced programmer but its worth viewing the simple parts such as "what is html" or "basics of javascript" ect as there are snippets of things to learn even if you have used these languages in the past. Once the basics are out the way however there is a mountain of information in this course.

If you are unsure of buying this course , just check out the final project "Solo" that we learn to create from scratch. It is a quality layout and certainly not something I ever thought I could do make before this course.

results.content: This course helped me to expand on my HTML skills and to learn and understand how CSS, JQuery and Bootstrap works. The CSS, Bootstrap and JQuery technologies were very well described and demonstrated impressively for anyone who never used these three pieces of tech like me for my upskilling by learning new technologies that I only touched upon in the past. The course was easy to follow and the concepts were highly intriguing which were explained clearly. results.content: The presentation is well done and you don't feel you have missed something after going through each topic. I did raise a question which was not answered, though I have taken another web programming courses where that happened and the course material was not as good as this with some material being over explained and other material  poorly explained.. Remember there is no server side material with this course but it is the best course for web programming I have taken so far.  The original course was about five years ago and I am not sure the recent update is as comprehensive as it could be but if you are starting out this course in my view  is as good as any and will take you a long way.  My only reservation is if you need to ask questions I do wonder whether you will get a reply. I only felt the need to ask one question  but if you need to ask a lot I wonder whether you will get reply and being stuck on a distance learning course with no help can be a real killer. The tutor makes many comments about supporting you but, as I say, I think the origins of this course are a few years old now and his focus may be elsewhere. Be aware the course uses Brackets code editor which I found problematic and gave up on. I used Sublime instead though the live preview  option did not work initially and was a bit of a fiddle to get running.

results.content:
Half way there - Course going well. I am starting to guess what is coming next, make less typing mistakes, and getting better at identifying why something isn't working and fixing it. jQuery syntax (all those brackets! / punctuation / strange case convention) is still a mystery

Completed course - overall rating - by 2021 it is rather out of date. Most of the course is Bootstrap 3 and Bootstrap is now on version 5. Tutor concentrates on what to do, not why we do it. This is less teaching, more learning by example. Tutor's use of English a bit flat and repetitive. But still, he knows his stuff and this was a decent primer on HTML/CSS, if a bit of a drag.

results.content:
This is truly an excellent course and is worth every of the 5 stars. Before this course I have completed separate HTML/CSS and JS courses. What I needed was a course which integrates both HML/CSS and JS. This course does not only accomplish that but also gives a good introduction to frameworks and plugins and shows in detail how to use and integrate them into the website. 
The course is presented in a pleasant way, and it is easy to follow. Although at times I would have wished a more detailed explanation on certain aspects, e.g how to integrate a real blog and how to receive a contact form on the server. Explanations, not the code to implement it because that would have definitely exceeded the scope of this course.
It would be nice if Irfan would do an advanced course addressing the above items and serverside programming in general taking the Solo website as base.
I can highly recommend this course to anybody who wants to learn how a website is created with more than just HTML/CSS 
An extra bonus is a categorized 4-page list with url’s of websites useful for web development.

results.content_html:
This is a great course, and the one I would recommend for any beginner. Upon completing the course, you will definitely be firmly grounded in the essentials of constructing a top-notch modern website. Do NOT be afraid of the duration. The most important investment of your time in web development is mastering the fundamentals, and this course delivers that in spades.

The instructor has expert skill, and speaks distinctly and with just the right speed. Everything is clearly explained. For me, the best feature of this course is that it provides a complete working web development environment with the best tools, customization and resources that you will need. This alone is worth taking this course.

I deducted a half-star only because it fell just a little short of being perfect. Specifically, this course could benefit greatly with the following changes:

-- add support for ultra-high-def displays (4K, 5K);
-- provide a secure working contact form (with Google reCaptcha v3);
-- integrate a blog (tumblr or wordpress) to the blog section;
-- how to learn better SEO and Google analytics.

results.content:
What can I say...GREAT course!! This course starts off with the basics and by the end you have a wonderful site and have learned a ton of information. Irfan provides you with the information in specific detail and explains things as he does them.

The added features provide you with different ways to make the site interactive and gives you many options to use once you are done.

I have thoroughly enjoyed the course and have already bought another one from him just to get a different look/feel even though the content may be similar in nature.

I would highly recommend this course to anyone just starting out, or still in the process of learning, as it provides a learning experience for both.

I am looking forward to the other class I purchased and would expect more of the same with that.

If I had any type of criticism, and I really don't, I would have liked to see some activity with the buttons - maybe linking to another page or something like that (i.e. pricing buttons), but the fact that they do nothing at the moment does not take away from this at all - and it leaves it open for the student to think about what they would do upon the button click.

Overall this is a well-designed, well instructed, and well thought out course. I learned a lot and cannot wait to use what I have learned!!

Rob Howard

results.content:
Pros: 
The course is good for people who don't know html , css, and java script. 
The instructor explains things as he types and how each code works.


Cons:
Outdated course needs to be updated. 

Very Very basic mostly relying on online source code ,so if you don't have a uncapped connection some scripted code would not display in the live preview. On top of that no code or script is given for the purchase buttons or the contact via email at the end no JS script basics or where to find how to learn how to do it. So if I build a website for some that needs a purchase option for the store online I wont know how to do it cause this course doesn't offer it. Most of the time I found myself looking on the net for ways to do this. 

Instructors accent is very thick and hard to understand and has a very bland tone to his teaching method, almost like he was reading from a written script. Which made him sound unenthusiastic and robotic with no excitement, like all he wanted to do was to get the lesson over and done with. This to me was the biggest problem with the course and at times annoying.

This is just my honest opinion please don't let this discourage you. 

If you can get pass the thick accent and robotic scripted tone of the instructor then this is good course for beginners, if you are an intermediate then I would suggest another course.  
Irfan knows his stuff but I think he needs to make it with a bit more ooomf in his voice and be more upbeat and excited about passing this awesome knowledge on.   

I won't say I didn't learn anything I'm learning a lot as I go through this course hopefully this rating will change as I progress.

results.content:
Very clear and concise. For native English speakers, Mr. Dayan is easy to understand and has a very calming and reassuring voice.

I like the flow and the baby steps approach to this class. This is basically a HTML and CSS refresher for me and am learning new tricks. The pace is just right for new and intermediate folks needing to learn a few tricks.

Most instructors and classes talk about wireframe at the end of their classes, which I never understood. This class discusses it as the very first thing you should do. Programmers using wireframe is like an artist using an outline / model for a painting.

I started taking a PHP class, but then switched to this. I.m glad I did. I feel this class is needed in order to build a solid foundation of the public side of web sites before I moved onto php and database integration for a project I want to build.

Overall, this class gives you a good solid foundation of building a website from start to finish and Mr. Dayan explains everything very clear and concisely.  This class gives you just enough to want to delve deeper into more advanced HTML, CSS, and JAVA scripting.

results.content: Irfan makes the questions section useless. Everything is clear and surprisingly free of repetition. The course is fast, engaging, concise and very educative. Some proactive researching is required from the student but to my mind it's a good aspect, allowing the course to focus on the vitals. Even so, Irfan guides you to such extra material all the time making it super easy for you to read further if you find it necessary or interesting. I haven't finished the course yet but can safely say it's worth more than charged. Sensei, you rock!
